trans-unit.source: This section shows how to send notifications from a .NET console app and any other.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to send notifications from a .NET console app and any other.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Mobile Services please refer to the [Get Started with Push](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started-push.md) tutorials.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Mobile Services please refer to the [Get Started with Push](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started-push.md) tutorials.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use Java or PHP refer to [How to use Notification Hubs from Java/PHP](../articles/notification-hubs/notification-hubs-java-backend-how-to.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to use Java or PHP refer to [How to use Notification Hubs from Java/PHP](../articles/notification-hubs/notification-hubs-java-backend-how-to.md).

trans-unit.source: You can send notifications from any backend using the [Notification Hub REST interface](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dn223264.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can send notifications from any backend using the [Notification Hub REST interface](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dn223264.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The following code sends notifications to Windows Store, Windows Phone, iOS, and Android devices.
trans-unit.target: The following code sends notifications to Windows Store, Windows Phone, iOS, and Android devices.

trans-unit.source: Skip steps 1-3 if you created a console app when you completed [Get started with Notification Hubs][get-started].
trans-unit.target: Skip steps 1-3 if you created a console app when you completed [Get started with Notification Hubs][get-started].

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio create a new Visual C# console application:
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio create a new Visual C# console application:

trans-unit.source: In the Visual Studio main menu, click **Tools**, **Library Package Manager**, and **Package Manager Console**, then in the console window type the following and press **Enter**:

trans-unit.source: This adds a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK by using the WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: This adds a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK by using the WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: Open the file Program.cs and add the following `using` statement:
trans-unit.target: Open the file Program.cs and add the following `using` statement:

trans-unit.source: In the `Program` class, add the following method, or replace it if it already exists:
trans-unit.target: In the `Program` class, add the following method, or replace it if it already exists:

trans-unit.source: This code sends notifications for each of the six tags in the string array to Windows Store, Windows Phone and iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: This code sends notifications for each of the six tags in the string array to Windows Store, Windows Phone and iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: The use of tags makes sure that devices receive notifications only for the registered categories.
trans-unit.target: The use of tags makes sure that devices receive notifications only for the registered categories.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This backend code supports Windows Store, Windows Phone, iOS, and Android clients.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This backend code supports Windows Store, Windows Phone, iOS, and Android clients.

trans-unit.source: Send methods return an error response when the notification hub hasn't yet been configured for a particular client platform.
trans-unit.target: Send methods return an error response when the notification hub hasn't yet been configured for a particular client platform.

trans-unit.source: In the above code, replace the `<hub name>` and `<connection string with full access>` placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for *DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature* that you obtained earlier.
trans-unit.target: In the above code, replace the `<hub name>` and `<connection string with full access>` placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for *DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature* that you obtained earlier.
